results.title: Murray River trip per 'Marion' July 1940
results.brief_description: Home movie of trip taken along the Murray River in July 1940 showing picturesque sights along the journey including the almond blossoms and oranges at Berri, South Australia; the junction of the Murray and Darling Rivers near Wentworth; the many lochs between Mildura to Morgan; paddle-steamers and a sunset on the Murray.

results.title: Murray River salination
results.brief_description: This film begins by showing the building of the Dartmouth Dam on the Mitta Mitta River to flush out the Murray River whose river basin is comparable to the Danube Basin, but has only 17% of the Danube’s flow. It shows the devastating impact of ever-increasing salinity in the Murray River on the agricultural productivity and the purity of Adelaide’s domestic water supply. Suggests ways of overcoming the salinity problem through saline interception schemes, such as those pioneered by the NSW government. A valuable insight to the political nature of the great Muray River by its custodians, Victoria, South Australia and New South Wales. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Murray River quest (A)
results.brief_description: This is the story of Australia’s greatest river seen through the eyes of two canoeists on an expedition seeking the history of the river and it’s importance in the development of Victoria and New South Wales. It tells of the Aborigines, explorers and town founders; of irrigators, woodcutters and fishermen - all those people whose lives and adventures make up the history of the Murray River.

results.title: Murphy's law
results.brief_description: Recommends thinking pre-planning and organisation as the ways in which to break Murphy’s Law - “If anything can go wrong, it will”. Sponsored by insurance companies to encourage development of emergency plans etc.

results.title: Muriel's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

results.title: Murder she said
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “4.50 from Paddington” by Agatha Christie also published as “What Mrs McGillicuddy Saw!” Dozing in her seat as the train leaves Paddington Station, Miss Jane Marple awakens to witness a strangulation aboard a passing train. The police do not believe her but undaunted, Miss Marple takes a job as a domestic in an attempt to discover the truth. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Arthur Kennedy, Muriel Pavlow and James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Murder on the orient express
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Based on Agatha Christie’s famous novel, this Sidney Lumet Film has an all star cast. The legendary Belgian detective Hercule Poirot encounters a murder when he is aboard the famous Orient Express. The train is stuck in a snowdrift so the murderer is still on the train and Poirot must sort through a multitude of clues, lies and false trails before the truth can be revealed.
Cast includes: Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Martin Balsam, Ingrid Bergman, Jacqueline Bisset, Sean Connery, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller, Anthony Perkins, Vanessa Redgrave, Richard Widmark and Michael York.

results.title: Murder most foul
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Ben Arbeid and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “Mrs. McGinty’s Dead” by Agatha Christie. Juror Miss Marple refuses to return a guilty verdict and initiates her own murder investigation backstage at a third-rate repertory company. A village baffler brimming with red herrings and tangled motives. Starring Margaret Rutherford and Ron Moody.

results.title: Murder in purdah (D)
results.brief_description: Presented as part of ABC TV’s ‘Foreign correspondent’ in May 1999, this British documentary looks at the devastating, and by Western standards unequitable restrictions that Islam and Pakistani society tradition places on women. It is a tradition that allows beating, burnings, murder and other atrocities to be perpetuated against women. There is also the strong possibility that these activities will continue, with strict Sharia law gaining political favour. ‘Murder in purdah’ is a testament to the desperation of the women affected by a climate of injustice based on patriarchal and religious tradition. Reporter: Olenka Frenkiel
